nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class Concordance

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.Concordance

  • public class Concordance
extends Object
    A concordance (left context, hit text, right context). Hits class matches this to the Hit.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Concordance(String[] conc)
      Construct a concordance.
      Concordance(String contents, int matchStart, int matchEnd)
      Construct a concordance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String left()
      Return the part of the content to the left of the matched part.
      String match()
      Return the matched part of the content.
      String[] parts()
      Return the three parts of the concordance: left, middle and right.
      String[] partsNoXml()
      Return the parts of the concordance with XML tags stripped out.
      String right()
      Return the part of the content to the right of the matched part.
      String toString()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Concordance

        public Concordance(String[] conc)
        Construct a concordance.
        Parameters:
        conc - array containing left part, match part and right part of the concordance

      • Concordance

        public Concordance(String contents,
                   int matchStart,
                   int matchEnd)
        Construct a concordance. Note that if it not guaranteed that each parts will be well-formed XML; if you require that, you should use XmlHighlighter to do this yourself.
        Parameters:
        contents - part of the document content to use as concordance
        matchStart - where the match starts
        matchEnd - where the match ends

        Return the part of the content to the left of the matched part.

      • match

        public String match()
        Return the matched part of the content.
        Returns:

      • right

        public String right()
        Return the part of the content to the right of the matched part.
        Returns:
        the right context

      • parts

        public String[] parts()
        Return the three parts of the concordance: left, middle and right.
        Returns:
        an array of concordance parts

      • partsNoXml

        public String[] partsNoXml()
        Return the parts of the concordance with XML tags stripped out.
        Returns:
        an array of three Strings: the left context, the matched text, and the right context.
